title: Justifying faith: or, That faith by which the just do live briefly describ'd in a discourse on 1 Joh. 5.12. By the author of a late book, entitled Summum bonum, or, An explication of the divine goodness, &c. To this discourse is added, an abstract of some letters to an eminent learned person, concerning the excellency of the Book of common prayer, &c.
author: Elys, Edmund, ca. 1634-ca. 1707.
publisher: printed for William Crook, at the sign of the Green Dragon without Temple-Bar,
notes: Dedication signed: E.E., i.e. Edmund Elys.
"An abstract of some letters to an eminent learned person, concerning the excellency of the Book of common-prayer, &c." has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous.
Identified as Wing E563 (entry cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.) on UMI microfilm set "Early English books, 1641-1700" reel 1883.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
